alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Essex (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 6:16PM EDT until July 09 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Vermont, including the following counties, Caledonia and Essex. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 613 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rainfall has occurred between Lunenberg and Maidstorn State Park. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Granby, Maidstone State Park, Ferdinand, Brunswick, Maidstone, East Haven, Guildhall, Bloomfield, Victory, Lunenburg, Lewis, Brighton, Newark, Burke, Gilman, Lemington, Kirby, Concord, Averill and Canaan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
